Miscellaneous Highlights: A 10-minute delay occurred in the seventh inning after a baseball appeared to be thrown in Jurickson Profar's direction and trash was thrown at Tatis.
Others: Max Muncy's solo home run with two outs in the ninth inning cut the deficit to eight.
Freddie Freeman's ankle injury forced him out of the game in the sixth inning.
The Dodgers' lineup went dormant after performing well in Game 1.
Shohei Ohtani, Mookie Betts, and the entire Dodgers lineup will need to perform better to overcome their deficit.
The Dodgers lost a 10-2 game to the San Diego Padres in Game 2 of the NLDS.
Fernando Tatis Jr. homered twice and improved to 9-for-14 in the postseason.
Jackson Merrill and Xander Bogaerts hit back-to-back home runs for the Padres.
The Dodgers' pitching struggled, with Jack Flaherty allowing four runs in 5 1/3 innings.
